abstract: GE-branded cordless phones will have a new button that directly dials Google’s free 411 service, making it easy to bypass paid directory assistance services.
snippet: GE-branded cordless phones will have a new button that directly dials Google’s free 411 service, making it easy to bypass paid directory assistance services.
lead_paragraph: In an earlier post about a new mobile search service from ChaCha, I noted that free 411 services like those offered by Google, Microsoft and others are not well know. In fact, informal surveys done by Sterling Market Intelligence suggest that three quarters of consumers are unfamiliar with these services.
